events.title: Execution of Giles Corey during Salem Witch Trials
events.description: Giles Corey was pressed to death during the Salem witch trials in Massachusetts after refusing to enter a plea. His death remains a notable example of the extreme measures taken amid the witchcraft hysteria.
events.significance: Highlights the dangers of mass hysteria and miscarriage of justice in history.

events.title: Battle of Borodino during Napoleonic Wars
events.description: The Battle of Borodino, one of the bloodiest single-day battles of the Napoleonic Wars, took place between Napoleon's French army and Russian forces near Moscow.
events.significance: Marked a critical and brutal confrontation in Napoleon’s Russian campaign, influencing the eventual retreat from Russia.

events.title: The Night of the Long Knives in Nazi Germany
events.description: Adolf Hitler ordered a series of political extrajudicial executions to consolidate power and eliminate rivals within the Nazi Party, notably the Sturmabteilung (SA) leadership.
events.significance: Consolidated Hitler’s absolute control over Germany and marked a turning point in Nazi consolidation of power.

events.title: First successful laser operation demonstrated by Theodore Maiman
events.description: Physicist Theodore Maiman operated the first functional laser at Hughes Research Laboratories, producing red laser light at a wavelength of 694 nanometers.
events.significance: Paved the way for laser technology impacting medicine, communications, and numerous industries.

events.title: August Coup in the Soviet Union begins
events.description: Hardline members of the Soviet government attempted a coup to take control from Mikhail Gorbachev, leading to a political crisis that accelerated the dissolution of the USSR.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the end for the Soviet Union and a major shift in global geopolitics.
